page.title: 11The School(3)
page.content:
The old school buildings, though internally changed, are much the same externally as in 1865. The old school entrance still boasts its bell which once summoned children from a wide area locally, the caretaker attended the school as a boy and talks of hearing the bell as he walked from Ixworth Thorpe, two miles to the South, and hoped it would not stop before he reached the school or he could be 'in for a beating'!
The front of the school, featured in one photograph of the village, shows the old bell and entrance with the church behind. The former was featured in external shots for the BBC TV series 'Dad's Army', probably because the author, David Croft, is a resident of the village in what was once Hall Farm, but is now Honington Hall.
